reviews.text: We arrived 5 minutes before check in and were given a lukewarm welcome before being told that it would be another 30 minutes before our rooms would be ready. That was okay as we wanted to do some walking around after driving most of the day. The rooms were small and slightly dated, even though appearing to be recently renovated (I know, contradictary). Bed was okay. Room and bathroom were clean. Would probably stay again, but would also probably check out other hotels.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel
Fantastic hotel and staff.
reviews.text: One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. Great staff and fantastic breakfast. The room was definitly 5 star.

reviews.title: loved it
reviews.text: stayed at The Pollard at the end of June 2004. it's a lovely hotel with great character. free continental breakfast or good choice from the menu. excellent food in the restaurant in the evening. we loved our room overlooking the main street (I normally worry about traffic noise but aside from Saturday night revellers it is not noisy). the hotel is very relaxed with lounges to read in, a gift shop and a very helpful front desk. one word of warning - the air-con was very noisy and you cannot control it from your room! Any problems you have to ask the desk to turn it off. Red Lodge is a fun place and there are great walks just back towards the Beartooth - try driving it in thunder, lightening and hail stones (on the 'wrong' side of the road) - it's a blast ! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and I am fussy !

reviews.title: The Pollard in Red Lodge 10********
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pollard a few years ago. It is one of the best places we have been. Our rooms were beautiful and luxurious! We had delicious, well prepared meals every day. The trip to the Beartooth Mountains was fantastic and coming back to the Pollard we were pampered and treated like royalty! 10 stars **********!

reviews.title: When in Red Lodge, there is only the Pollard!
A very Elegant hotel
reviews.text: Aahh..the Pollard. What a beautiful hotel. My husband and I have been there many times. You will absolutly want to make reservations at the resturant in the hotel. There is nothing like having a chef prepare your meal. Enjoy a drink and read about the hotels history in the sitting room. The rooms are wonderful. Dark carpets and woods, terry robes, comfortable beds, and fantastic views-not matter which room you get. (Some rooms have balconies or windows over looking the gallary) The staff is friendly and very helpful. Not to mention you get a free breakfast in the morning. A totally enjoyable enviroment. That's why we come back every year. Come see this historic hotel for yourself!!!
